About Our Mission

Learn about our organization's history, mission, and the impact we're making in children's lives through our comfort programs.

Join Our Team

Our Story

Savvy Stuffies was founded in 2015 by Sarah Johnson, a former emergency room nurse who witnessed firsthand the comfort that stuffed animals brought to children in crisis situations.

After responding to a house fire where a young girl lost everything, Sarah gave the child her own childhood teddy bear. The transformation in the child's demeanor was immediate and profound.

This experience inspired Sarah to start collecting stuffed animals to distribute to first responders, hospitals, and shelters. The organization grew from there, eventually adding the innovative "Guns for Toys" program that helps remove unwanted firearms from homes while funding the purchase of new stuffed animals.

Our Mission & Values

Mission

To provide comfort to children experiencing trauma or crisis through the gift of stuffed animals, while simultaneously reducing the number of unwanted firearms in our communities.

Vision

A world where every child in crisis has a comforting stuffed animal to hold, and where communities are safer through responsible firearm reduction.

Compassion

We approach our work with empathy and understanding for children and families experiencing trauma.

Community

We believe in the power of communities coming together to support their most vulnerable members.

Safety

We are committed to creating safer communities through responsible firearm reduction.

Our Team

The dedicated people behind Savvy's Stuffies

Sarah Johnson

Founder & Executive Director

Former pediatric nurse who founded Savvy's Stuffies after her daughter's accident.

Michael Rodriguez

Operations Director

Former police officer who oversees our Guns for Toys program.

Jennifer Lee

Program Coordinator

Manages our hospital partnerships and stuffed animal distribution.

David Thompson

Volunteer Coordinator

Oversees our volunteer program and community outreach efforts.

Bringing comfort to children in crisis through stuffed animal donations and gun buyback programs.
